title: George Ford: 'England against New Zealand is a pressurised game for both sides... but we wouldn't want to be anywhere else'
text:
George Ford insists England can impose their game plan on New Zealand and match the attacking threats of Steve Hansen’s side in Saturday's World Cup semi-final in Tokyo.

Ford has been handed the responsibility of running the side’s attacking game after Eddie Jones recalled the Leicester Tigers fly-half, with Owen Farrell returning to inside centre.

Jones believes the dual playmaker combination will allow England to dominate territory, with heavy rainfall expected on Saturday, while fielding two distributors will allow England greater attacking options.

Ford acknowledges that New Zealand, with Richie Mo’unga starting at 10 and Beauden Barrett at full-back, will pose serious questions of the England...
description: George Ford insists England can impose their game plan on New Zealand and match the attacking threats of Steve Hansen’s side in Saturday's World Cup semi-final in Tokyo.
